intro: Samyda octandra, commonly known as the eight-angled samyda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular, woody stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Samyda octandra is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
